result.markdown: --- title: "Problem Set 0: Computing environment" --- **Due: 5pm on Friday, January 10.** To complete the problem set, download pset0.qmd. Add these four lines of code to the top if they do not appear in your download, ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} --- title: "Problem Set 0: Computing environment" format: pdf --- ``` ::: and render to a PDF. You will then submit two things: 1) Upload the rendered PDF to BruinLearn 2) In our [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfMxlewBaz7QJ3uKNCsj2g5rukOOumqrZVAnu-ckybbfwvFsg/viewform?usp=sf_link), tell us your anonymous identifier that appears in your rendered PDF. ## Help with gettinng started If you are stuck, make sure that you first follow the installation instructions in [setting up your computer](../topics/r_basics.qmd). Open the downloaded problem set in RStudio. You should then click the "Render" button as shown in the image below. ![](../assets/pset0/render.png) This will run the R code and combine the output with the text in the document into a PDF. By default, this PDF will be output in the same directory that you saved `pset0.qmd` in. You will then submit the PDF on Canvas. ## Issues If you run into issues while attempting to render the Problem Set, be sure to open a question on [Piazza]("https://piazza.com/class/m3q7dpj6kqd2fn")!
